<small>Also see: **<big>[[H1791|דֵּךְ]]</big>**</small>

 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִלֵּךְ‎</span> **demonstrative pronoun plural** ==these== (plural of  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דֵּךְ‎</span>, q. v.: Egyptian Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אלך‎</span> ([[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>207</sup> RES<sup>361</sup> [[BDB#B|B]] [[BDB#S-C|S-C]]<sup>Pap. E 6</sup>+): with ***hâ*** prefixed, Old Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, feminine <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>§ 67</sup>, [[BDB#Marti|M]]<sup>§ 82</sup> Burkitt<sup>Evang. da-Mepharreshe ii.42, Christian-Palestinian</sup> Aramaic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> (masculine and feminine) [[BDB#Schw|Schw]]<sup>Idioticon 24</sup>; compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">: [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>Lex.1057</sup>: the demonstrative affix <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎ך‎</span> as in <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דֵּךְ‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, etc.; [[BDB#W|W]]<sup>CG 110</sup>); — ***these***, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎גֻּבְרַיָּא‎</span> <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִלֵּךְ‎</span> ***these men***, [[Dan.3.12|Dan 3:12]]; [[Dan.3.13|Dan 3:13]]; [[Dan.3.21|Dan 3:21]]; [[Dan.3.22|Dan 3:22]]; [[Dan.3.23|Dan 3:23]]; [[Dan.3.27|Dan 3:27]]; [[Dan.6.6|Dan 6:6]]; [[Dan.6.12|Dan 6:12]]; [[Dan.6.16|Dan 6:16]]; [[Dan.6.25|Dan 6:25]]; [[Ezra.4.21|Ezra 4:21]]; [[Ezra.16.8|Ezra 16:8]]b; also [[Ezra.5.9|Ezra 5:9]]; [[Ezra.6.8|Ezra 6:8]]a.
